items.sentence: Tom needed money to pay his rent, so he sold his trombone.
I hope to see you again the next time you're in Australia.
I left Australia three years ago and I've never been back.
I might not be able to go to Australia with you next week.
I thought that you said that you weren't afraid of ghosts.
Can you stand on one leg for a minute with your eyes shut?
Your posture makes you look shorter than you actually are.
Tom admitted that he was the one who had stolen the horse.
I can't figure out how Tom was able to do that so quickly.
Who do you think speaks French more fluently, Tom or Mary?
Tom wanted to buy one of these, but I bought the last one.
You won't be able to sell that without lowering the price.
You're not really going to buy Tom's old tractor, are you?
Could you ask Tom what time the meeting is going to start?
I don't think Tom will ever get over the loss of his wife.
Tom doesn't have to tell Mary anything he doesn't want to.
I've been doing it this way for as long as I can remember.
Tom felt insignificant when he looked up at the night sky.
Tom was active in student politics in his university days.
Tom is a night owl, but he's very sluggish in the morning.
